runs.comm: length ball, pitches outside leg, flicked away to the right of deep fine leg for a couple
no swing, and it starts wide outside leg again. A slightly nervous start or lack of swing?
this one swings the other way, down the leg side, de Kock misses, but gets two leg-byes
lucky four runs. This is short, angling away, he has the room to go after it, but not enough. Gets the bottom edge, past the diving Dhoni. Slightly nervous from both the batsman and the bowler

oh he has given this. is it nervous from the umpire too or a great decision? De Kock is not happy with the call. He goes for a big drive to a length ball outside off, the fielders go up immediately for the inside edge, Ian Gould raises his finger after thinking about it. De Kock is not thrilled about the decision. Replays show there is a sound as it passes the bat, so the umpire has got it right
good first ball for du Plessis. Pitches on a length, just outside off, swings back in towards off. Defended off the front foot
big swing but too straight, and has been clipped away for one
length ball outside off, he strides forward, moves into it, and pushes it wide of cover for two
pushes off the front foot, slightly to the left of cover, and he sets off immediately for a quick single
short of a length, outside off, punched away off the back foot, but can't beat cover
full, on the pads, Amla misses out. He has found the man at midwicket with the flick
mis-hits a shortish ball outside off, hit on the inside half of the bat. Three dots already for Amla
wide length ball, he drives, but can't beat the man at cover. Four dots for Amla, good start for Mohit
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
Amla gets off the mark with a push wide of mid-on
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
this one holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge as he looks to open the face of the bat
short of a length, angling in, pushed to leg for one
short of a length, holds its line outside off, Amla still manages to place it wide of mid-on for one
that's Amla showing his inner Dilshan. Stands tall, clears the front leg, and smashes this short ball through cover. Meets it on the top of the bounce
slower ball from Sharma, but Amla moves across to open up the leg side, and takes a couple fine of fine leg

these are some lucky runs. Amla shows Shamra that he is moving away, but stays his ground when the ball is delivered. Sharma stays straight, but can't do anything about the outside edge that goes wide of Dhoni
moves across this time, is beaten, but gets a leg-bye
du Plessis opens up. Moves across to a length ball, and whips it over the leg side. Over midwicket
and du Plessis moves across again, and bunts this into the leg side. Straight of deep midwicket. Comes back for the second
lovely shot from Amla. Short of a length, angling in, and he has caressed it past midwicket. Yuvraj escorts it to the fence
tries another flick to leg, but is beaten and is hit on the pad
good delivery. Short of a length, on off. No room. Nor is it too straight. Defended
another Dilshan shot from Amla. Opens the front leg, and smashes this over extra cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
lovely punch from du Plessis but he can't beat extra cover with that
and he starts with a wide down leg

what a superb delivery from Ashwin. He bowls the carrom ball that pitches well outside leg, Amla plays for it, but the ball has turned more than he expects, and has pegged back the off stump. Will this be the moment people will talk about for years?
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
flighted, on the toes, defended to midwicket
flighted outside leg, Duminy tries the sweep, but is beaten
defended from the crease
another defensive shot brings to end a superb over. Match-turning one?
flighted on off, driven down the ground for one
Duminy uses his feet, gets right to the pitch of the ball, drives this to long-on for one
down the wicket again, pushes this to long-on for one
appeal for lbw as he is beaten on the sweep, but this has hit outside the line. Jadeja has run into du Plessis while appealing, and Gould asks him to watch it
down the wicket but can't beat midwicket
another sweep, another lbw appeal. This one is closer but Gould says no. Turning too much? Hit him outside the line?
and he too starts with a wide
offbreak, hits the inside half of the bat, goes for a single to leg
low full toss, driven wide of long-on for a couple
driven with the turn, but Jadeja dives at extra cover to take the sting off it
down the wicket, looks to work this to leg, can't beat midwicket
flighted outside off, looks to drive it to long-off, can't beat Raina
down the wicket again, plays it with soft hands, past midwicket for a single
du Plessis is down the wicket again, pushes this flat delivery into the leg side for one
on a length, outside off, guided to the left of short third, gets a single
flat, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, angling in, punched to long-on
Faf is down again, looks to push this to leg, gets a thick leading edge past cover
this one turns in from short of a length, cramps him up, Duminy can't place this dab well
short of a length, down the wicket, but can't bat midwicket

slightly short of a length, he goes back to go over the man at midwicket. Rohit comes around from square leg, slides, gets behind it, but it slides. Just doesn't get it clean. And it goes for four. Kohli, who has run in from long-on, is livid. He kicks the ball away
Faf makes room, shows him all three stumps, the ball turns back in, takes the inside edge. Single taken
short of a length, into the pads, whipped away for one
makes room to go over extra but the ball is gripping. Turns back more than expected, and goes to long-on off the inside edge
short of a length, on off, pushed to long-off for one
slow sweep first ball, but Dhoni has a fielder for it at deep midwicket. Just the single
Faf jumps away from the stumps to go over extra, but the ball dips and drifts and then turns away too far past the edge
Faf down the wicket, this is a big no-ball, played back to Mishra, and Faf dives back into the crease
lovely shot. He is down the wicket early, reaches the pitch of a quickish delivery, and chips it over extra cover. On a knee too
big turn. Slower and higher this time, pitches outside leg. The turn cramps Faf, who is already down the wicket, and has to play a defensive shot lest he miss and get stumped
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for one to leg
full and fast, too full for Duminy to try the slog sweep. Drives this to long-on for one
turn and bounce as he tries to pull. Beaten. As is Dhoni. Takes a bye
stays back to pull a shortish ball wide of long-on for two. Kohli slips as he fields
presses forward, gets under a length ball, and sweeps it over square leg for four
down the wicket this time, is beaten a bit in the air, but he manages the turn well, and places this wide of deep square for two
one-handed six off a spinner. Incredible. He tries the sweep, not to the reach of it outside off, the bottom hand comes off as he sweeps, but it still miraculously carries over square leg
down the wicket to push this to long-on for one

another incredible shot. Skipper Faf is getting into this here. He jumps away from the stumps to open the off side again, and he is all but beaten by the excessive turn. He still goes ahead with it, away from the body, and somehow manages to lob it over point for four. Fifty for the partnership
driven to long-off to bring up the fifty for Faf. Cometh the hour, cometh the captain?
oh a fullie. Duminy will slog-sweep this for hours on end. Sends it way over deep midwicket
wrong'un, too short, and punched to deep midwicket for one
too short, pulled wide of long-on, but Kohli does well there to keep them down to one
too full, outside leg, tries the wrong'un but half-volleys don't turn. Duminy sweeps it, sweeps it square and along the ground. Beats the fielder to his left
appeal for a catch down the leg side, but this is only to make sure it is not a wide. And the ball has hit the thigh pad. So Dhoni and Dharmasena do well here
first really poor delivery from Ahswin. Too shirt, pitches outside leg, and Faf pulls it over wide long-on for six. They knock the gloves after the hit. He is using the depth of the crease superbly
swept away off a length, gets a single
tries to sweep this from leg, gets a leg-bye

Faf is bowled. Ashwin has done it again, but this is a strange dismissal, something we are quite used to seeing in T20s. Faf jumps away again to make room, Ashwin bowls a carrom ball that pitches well outside leg. Faf tries to go over the leg side, but misses, and it has gone off his body to tickle the off bail off
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep point for one
flighted on off, driven towards extra cover, Yuvraj misfields, allows two runs
another drive to extra cover, but this time Yuvraj fields well
slightly short of a length, quick too, AB is clearly beaten by the trajectory, but he gets enough bat on it to chip it over Mishra's head

what a shot. AB tells Dhoni you need more fielders. You need a field for a left-hand and a right-hand batsman. He has taken this full ball from a foot outside leg, and has reverse-swept it past slip for four
driven to deep cover for one
wrong'un, on a length, outside leg, bunted away with soft hands, between long-on and deep midwicket. Comes back for two
AB looks to sweep a wide ball outside leg fine, but gets only a faint tickle to short fine
driven to long-off for one

three Ashwin overs, three huge wickets. Is he turning this match for India? This, for a change, is a long hop outside leg. A blindfolded AB can hit these for sixes, but this time he gets a top edge and is caught at long leg
shortish, gets turn and bounce, but the edge doesn't carry to short third
pushed to extra cover
short of a length, takes it from off, gets a single to deep midwicket
flat, into the pads, gets a single to leg
on a length, on off, pushed past cover for one
stays back to a length ball, nurdles it for one to leg
short of a length, punched straight of the diving short straight cover for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one to deep square
short of a length, stays low, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, offbreak, pushed through cover for one
big shout for lbw as he is beaten on the sweep, but this has hit him on top of the pad. No lbw here
jumps at him, right to its pitch, swings through smoothly, and clears long-on easily. Beautiful old-fashioned shot
tries the sweep from outside off, gets a bottom edge through Dhoni's legs
gets a single to leg
Ashwin's first wicketless over comes to an end. Worked away off the pads to deep midwicket
low full toss, pretty straight, hit back at him. Valuable dot
tries the cute ramp over fine leg to a length ball, but is beaten. Two dots, and pressure will be on Duminy now
that's a monster hit from Duminy. Stands strong, in the crease, gets under a length ball, and swings it clear over square leg. Don't bowl length at the death. Someone in the crowd seems to be hit
slower ball, Duminy adjusts late, opens the face, gets a single to short third
what a shot. Top shot this. Low full toss, nearly a yorker, he can't get under it, but he drives this hard and beats the diving extra cover by inches
well bowled to finish the over. A perfect yorker. He has dug this out to leg, and scampers through for one. Was out if Bhuvneshwar had hit the non-striker's end
lucky to get away with a length ball. That was in the slot to hit a six. Doesn't get a good hit. Takes a single to long-on
wide yorker, squirted out for a single. Good start to the over for India
misses the yorker by inches, and Mohit makes him pay for it. Gets under this low full toss, lofted straight of mid-off for a flat six. Top shot
good wide yorker. Just inside those tram lines. Beats the inside edge as he tries to squirt it past short third

tries the wide yorker, but the third man is in. Don't quite get that plan. If you are bowling wide yorkers, have third man back. Miller drives this half-volley, and goes over short third for four. South Africa have never lost after scoring more than 166
good finish by Mohit, a yorker, middle and leg, he digs it out towards deep midwicket. He stumbles as he runs but has enough time to come back for the second
